charts.name: 3D Gulf of Mexico Deep
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor. 
  • Location: Gulf of Mexico from Texas to Florida.
  • Size:  Approximately 62,000 square miles.
  • Depths:  300ft to 6,000ft.
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, VesselView, iPhone, iPad, Android tablets, and PC.
  • Resolution: Good throughout.
  • Notes: Deeeeep dropping and trolling. If you'd like the areas south of Louisiana, check out our Louisiana charts.

charts.name: 3D North Carolina Offshore
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Location: From Virginia Beach, VA to the NC/SC border
  • Size:  33,700 square miles.  225 miles from south to north.
  • Depths: 8m to 5,000m
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, iPhone, iPad, Android tablets, and PC.
  • Resolution: Varies depending on the quality of data available. In general, good resolution in the canyons.
  • Notes: Tuna, Mahi, you name it. Bring plenty of fuel!

charts.name: 3D Chesapeake Nearshore
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Location: From Wildwood Crest, NJ, to south of Virginia Beach, VA from the coast to approximately 30 miles offshore.
  • Size:  140 miles from south to north.
  • Depths: 10ft to 120ft
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, iPhone, iPad, Android tablets, and PC.
  • Resolution: Varies depending on the quality of data available. In general, shallower depths are higher resolution.
  • Notes: Wrecks, sand waves, rock formations, and lots of great fishing!

charts.name: 3D Chesapeake Offshore
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Location: The Atlantic Shelf Edge from Berkley Canyon to 20 miles south of Norfolk Canyon, roughly from Virginia Beach, VA to Sea Isle City, NJ, with high resolution shelf edge data starting from 60 to 80 miles offshore depending on the coastline.
  • Size:  160 miles from south to north.
  • Depths: 50m to 3,000m
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, iPhone, iPad, Android tablets, and PC.
  • Resolution: Varies. Shallow areas (orange and green) are very low resolution. Canyons (blue) are the highest resolution available.
  • Notes: Gorgeous imagery of the canyons and shelf edge drop-off.  Bring your electric reels or trolling gear!

charts.name: 3D Chesapeake Bay
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Location: Chesapeake Bay and major rivers. Covers Belcamp, Baltimore, Annapolis, Cambridge, Virginia Beach, Washington D.C., and coastal beaches from Knotts Island to Ocean City.
  • Size:  150 miles from Virginia Beach to Baltimore and Washington D.C.
  • Depths: 0-75 feet
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, iPhone, iPad, Android tablets, and PC.
  • Resolution: Varies from extremely high resloution in deep areas of the southern and central bay to medium resolution in shallow inshore rivers.
  • Notes: This chart covers a lot of ground and shows some interesting structure. Rocks and dredge dumps. Channel edges, sand bars and exposed fractured bedrock. See the preview gallery for more info.

charts.name: 3D Louisiana Offshore / Flower Garden Banks
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Location: 100 mi SE of Galveston Island, 75 mi S of Port Arthur, 75 mi S of Morgan City
  • Coverage:  Northwest Gulf of Mexico shelf edge reef banks. 
  • Size:  W 265 mi x H 65 mi  
  • Depths: 50-3,000 ft
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, iPhone, iPad, Android tablets, and PC.
  • Notes: This chart covers more than two dozen famous coral reef banks in the Northwestern Gulf of Mexico. Most of the reefs are in 65-150 feet of water, and this chart's depth shader is designed to really make the reefs pop out in red, yellow and green.
  • Resolution: Varies on this chart. Many of the well known reef banks are displayed in beautiful high resolution. The deepwater salt domes and basins just south of the bank area also extremely HD -- they use brand new oil-industry data from 2017. Shallow-water areas and some of the lesser known reef banks are displayed in lower, but usable, resolution.
  • It's a long run to this part of the Gulf, don't go unprepared! This StrikeLines chart will show you exactly where you need to be.

charts.name: 3D North East Canyons
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See HD images in gallery below.** 3D North East Canyons:
  • Description: High definition 3D imagery of the seafloor 
  • Coverage: 350 miles of canyons along the Atlantic Shelf Edge from Spencer Canyon to Powell Canyon and everything in between.  
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, mobile devices, and computers.
  • Notes: Great chart for fast boats and deep dropping or trolling. The best available imagery of the Canyons.

charts.name: 3D Puget Sound
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Coverage: Puget Sound waterways: Including Olympia, Tacoma, Seattle, Victoria, Port Townsend, Oak Harbor, Port Angeles, the San Juan Islands and the Strait of Juan de Fuca. 
  • Size: 135 mi north to south, 54 mi east to west.  
  • Depths: 0-1,000 ft
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, iPhone, iPad, Android tablets, and PC.
  • Notes: This is a huge chart with a large amount of very high quality sonar data. Huge boulder piles. 500 foot underwater cliffs. Pockmarked muddy bottom (possibly fish holes?) This chart will absolutely put you on fish. Cod, halibut, flounder, rockfish. This is a great fishing chart.

charts.name: 3D FL East Deep Drop Reefs
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Coverage: East coast deep drop reefs from Miami, Fla. to Savannah, Ga.  
  • Distance from shore to chart center: Miami, 18mi; West Palm, 20 mi; Palm Bay, 50 mi; Daytona Beach, 75 mi; Jacksonville, 100 mi; Savannah, 110 mi.
  • Depths: 600 ft - 2,600 ft
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, iPhone, iPad, Android tablets, and PC.
  • Notes: This chart has HD sonar coverage of more than 500 square miles of rugged corals and rocky bottom. The majority of the reefs are in 1,500 to 2,000 feet of water, putting them just within range of competent deep drop fishermen. 
  • Data quality: Very little is known about the deep rock outcrops and ancient coral reefs in this region. There have only been a handful of scientific sonar surveys conducted here. This chart is a compilation of the best survey data available. We've combined about a dozen separate surveys to make this chart. Some are better than others, so data coverage and resolution vary depending on the area. See the preview photos for an idea.
  • This is not our best looking chart, but it might be our best fishing chart. Get ready to get your rod bent.

charts.name: 3D San Francisco Bay
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Coverage: San Francisco Bay (North, South and Central), San Pablo Bay east to Collinsville. Nearshore Pacific Reefs from San Gregorio in the south to Jenner in the north. 
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, mobile devices, and computers.
  • Notes: Very high resolution data in deep bay waters and along the Pacific coastline. Slightly lower resolution in shallow bay areas and deep offshore waters. Lots of very nice boulder piles and rocky hardbottom structure.

charts.name: 3D New York Offshore
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See HD images in gallery below.** New York and New Jersey Offshore:
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Coverage: South shore of Long Island to Delaware Bay. Up to 200 miles offshore depending on shoreline.
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, mobile devices, and computers.
  • Notes: Great rock areas, possible wrecks, NY harbor, and other areas of interest.  Resolution varies depending on the area.

charts.name: 3D Florida East Coast Beach Reefs
charts.description:
*Preview Map Is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images.*
  • Description: High definition 3D images of  coral reefs. 
  • Range: Snorkeling range from shore. Most of these reefs are in 20 feet of water or less. 
  • Coverage: Beach reefs and nearshore wrecks from Miami to Jacksonville. 
  • Max depth: 30 feet (HD Data)
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, Android, iPhone, iPad and home computers. 
  • Notes: There are tons of big natural reefs within 2 miles of the beach in South Florida, and this chart shows them all. Miami, Fort Lauderdale, Boca Raton, Boynton Beach, West Palm Beach and Jupiter.

charts.name: 3D Tampa Bay
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See product gallery below for HD sample images.**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Range: Inshore Tampa Bay and St Pete beaches
  • Coverage: Full coverage from downtown Tampa to Bradenton, including Anna Maria, St Pete Beach and Treasure Island. 
  • Max depth: 50 feet
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, Android, iPhone, iPad and home computers. 
  • Notes: Lots of nice rockpiles and wrecks in Tampa Bay and a couple nearshore reefs off of Anna Maria.

charts.name: 3D Louisiana Nearshore
charts.description:
**Preview map is in LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD chart imagery.**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Range: 0-30 miles from the Louisiana coast
  • Coverage: New Iberia to the Chandeleur Islands
  • Max depth: 480 feet
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, PC and Mobile Devices
  • Notes: Lots of big structure. Oil rigs, shipwrecks, massive natural cliffs and rockpiles.

charts.name: 3D Block Island and Rhode Island Sounds
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Coverage: Block Island Sound and Rhode Island Sound from Gardiner's Point to Pollock Rip including Martha's Vineyard, Buzzards Bay, Narragansett Bay, and Nantucket.
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, mobile devices, and computers.
  • Notes: Wrecks, great rock areas, and other areas of interest.  Resolution varies depending on the area.

charts.name: 3D Long Island Sound
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images.**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Coverage: Long Island Sound from Manhattan to Gardiner's Point including Oyster, Huntington, Northpoint, Gardiner's, Shelter Island, Peconic and other bays and sounds.
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, mobile devices, and computers.
  • Notes: Hundreds of wrecks, great rock areas, and other areas of interest.  Resolution varies depending on the area.

charts.name: Wrecks – Narragansett Bay
charts.description:
Forty-two wrecks in Narragansett Bay.

We combed through thousands of square miles of high resolution multi-beam sonar data from the East River to Cape Cod to bring you these wreck charts.  Every wreck we found was carefully marked and locations are accurate to within a few feet.

If you've got an interest in shipwrecks and diving or fishing, our wreck charts are for you!  Don't waste time and fuel searching for a wreck - only some of which are even charted - when we can provide the exact location.

Our wreck charts can be displayed on your phone, tablet, or computer with a variety of apps or on just about any chart plotter.  On a marine chart plotter the waypoints will overlay on top of your normal chart.

After checkout and in your order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.description:

We combed through thousands of square miles of high resolution multi-beam sonar data from the East River to Cape Cod to bring you these wreck charts.  Every wreck we found was carefully marked and locations are accurate to within a few feet.

charts.description:
Fifty-five wrecks with exact locations in western Long Island Sound close to Eaton's Neck.

We combed through thousands of square miles of high resolution multi-beam sonar data from the East River to Cape Cod to bring you these wreck charts.  Every wreck we found was carefully marked and locations are accurate to within a few feet.

charts.name: Pipeline – No Imagery
charts.description:
The Pipeline chart without sonar imagery.

You asked and we scanned, from seven miles out of Tampa to south of Pensacola.  And we're not just releasing a chart of the Gulfstream Natural Gas Pipeline.  We have also included coordinates for the valve boxes we could find and the boulder field and artificial reef mitigation sites.

This chart includes several waypoints in the Madison Swanson protected area.  Please follow all applicable laws, rules, and regulations.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: 3D Gulf of Maine
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images.**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor.
  • Coverage: Gulf of Maine, including Bar Harbor, Casco Bay, Portsmouth, Boston, Cape Cod Bay, Jeffreys Ledge, and more.
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, mobile devices, and computers.
  • Notes: Huge hard bottom areas, rocky channels, swells, basins, ledges, and banks. Resolution varies depending on the area.

charts.name: 3D Florida Keys
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Range: Florida Keys from Miami to the Dry Tortugas
  • Max depth: 50 feet
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, Android, iPhone, iPad and home computers. 
  • Notes: High resolution coverage of all southern and eastern reef systems. Also includes all rivers and cuts through the islands.

charts.name: 3D Florida Canyons (2018 update!)
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for sample HD images.**
  • Description: Updated West Florida Canyons v2. Now with even more high resolution coverage of the seafloor. 
  • Coverage: From Key West to Cedar Key - more than 300 miles of canyons along the West Florida Shelf edge. 
  • Distance to shelf edge from shore: Tampa, 150 mi; Sarasota, 150 mi; Sanibel Island, 175 mi; Naples, 140 mi; Key West, 65 mi. 
  • Depth: About 300 ft deep at the shelf edge. 1,500 feet at the top of the canyons.  Dropping to a max of 9,000 ft where the canyons bottom out into the Florida Plain.
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, mobile devices, and home PC. 
  • Notes: Great chart for fast boats and deep dropping. Includes brand new HD data from a 2018 survey. There is some seriously rugged bottom in this part of the gulf. Like dropping a line into the Grand Canyon from a helicopter... Bring your electric reels.

charts.name: Big Bend
charts.description:
With five hundred and fifty seven spots from Crystal River to Apalachicola, the Big Bend chart contains hard bottom, live bottom, artificials, wrecks, ledges, and more.  It is some of the best grouper fishing we've found.

The closest spot to the mouth of Crystal River is 37 miles west.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: Pipeline
charts.description:
Now includes mitigation sites and valve boxes!

You asked and we scanned, from seven miles out of Tampa to south of Pensacola.

And we're not just releasing a chart of the Gulfstream Natural Gas Pipeline. We're throwing in the side-scan imagery of the pipeline itself that you can view in Google Earth, over half a gigabyte of it.  You'll see the rock piles - sometimes on top, sometimes to the sides - used to stabilize the pipeline, note where the pipeline goes underground, spot schools of bait, and laugh at our curving path when we avoided boats and fought with the autopilot.

We have also included coordinates for the valve boxes we could find and the boulder field and artificial reef mitigation sites.  However, imagery for the mitigation sites is not included.

Remember that weather window around Valentine's day?  That's how fresh this data is.  And don't be surprised if our chart doesn't overlay exactly on top of the pipeline marked on your chartplotter.  Check it for yourself.

This chart includes several waypoints in the Madison Swanson protected area.  Please follow all applicable laws, rules, and regulations.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: FREE – Blackthorn Charter Sample
charts.description: Here's a free sample chart that shows how we use side-scan sonar to map out a cool ledges in state waters near St. Pete. We use high-resolution side-scan sonar data to search for promising structure. When we find something, we mark up the spot, give  it a name, and then trace out the structure with simplified lines. Then we convert these lines and points into electronic chart files that can be downloaded directly into your boat's GPS.  Lines have been omitted from this sample to allow better viewing of the underlying imagery. This free preview is only available in Google Earth KMZ format. Google Earth is available for free from Google here.  For GPS/Chartplotter formats, check out our full charts.

charts.name: Sarasota Offshore
charts.description:
Located in federal waters from Sister Keys to South Venice, the Offshore Sarasota chart includes hard bottom, ledges, live bottom, artificials, wrecks, a huge sinkhole, and other features.  The chart extends from 9 to 90 miles offshore and contains 668 spots.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: Anna Maria Offshore
charts.description:
Located in federal waters from Egmont Key to Sister Keys, the Offshore Anna Maria chart includes hard bottom, ledges, live bottom, artificials, pipe dredges, wrecks and other features.  The chart extends from nine miles to forty miles offshore and contains 555 spots.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: St Pete Offshore
charts.description:
Located in federal waters from Redington Shores to Egmont Key, the Offshore St Pete chart contains almost 1,100 waypoints and includes some of the best hard bottom and ledges we've seen along with live bottom, lots of artificials, wrecks and other features.  The chart extends from nine to forty miles offshore.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: Clearwater Offshore
charts.description:
Located in federal waters from Tarpon Springs to Redington Shores, the Offshore Clearwater chart contains 816 waypoints and includes rough hard bottom, rugged ledges, sinkholes, live bottom, lots of artificials, and other features.  The chart extends from nine miles to thirty miles offshore.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us. Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: Tarpon Springs
charts.description:
Located in federal waters from Weeki Watchi to Tarpon Springs, with a little bit of state water hard bottom thrown in, the Offshore Tarpon Springs chart contains rough hard bottom, rugged ledges, live bottom, and other features.  This chart contains 105 waypoints.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: FREE – Tampa Lobster Ledge
charts.description: Here's a free sample chart that shows how we use side-scan sonar to map out a cool ledges in state waters near St. Pete. We use high-resolution side-scan sonar data to search for cool structure. When we find something, we mark up the spot, give  it a name, and then trace out the structure with simplified lines. Then we convert these lines and points into electronic chart files that can be downloaded directly into your boat's GPS. This free preview is only available in Google Earth KMZ format. For GPS/Chartplotter formats, check out our full St. Pete Nearshore chart, which marks more than 400 great fishing spots in this same area.

charts.name: Ft Myers Nearshore
charts.description:
Located in state waters (within 9 nautical miles of shore) from South Venice to just north of Marco Island, the Nearshore Ft Myers chart contains great ledges, rocky hard bottom, large areas of debris, lots of artificials, wrecks, and other features.  This chart contains 280 waypoints.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: Sarasota Nearshore
charts.description:
Located in state waters (within 9 nautical miles of shore) from Longboat Key to South Venice, the huge Nearshore Sarasota chart contains tons of great ledges, rocky hard bottom, massive areas of debris, soft coral, large artificials, wrecks, and other features.  This chart includes 240 waypoints.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: 3D Middle Grounds
charts.description:
**Preview map is LOW RESOLUTION. See gallery below for HD sample images**
  • Description: High definition 3D images of the seafloor 
  • Coverage: Florida Middle Grounds. 
  • Works on: Lowrance, Simrad, B&G, mobile devices, and computers.
  • Notes: Great relief and depth changes.
  This is a very cool 3D bottom map of the famous Florida Middle Grounds, located about 100 miles offshore, about half way between Tampa and Apalachicola. Currently only available for Lowrance, Simrad and Google Earth.

charts.name: Sticky Grounds South
charts.description:
Located about 100 miles west of Tampa, the Sticky Grounds are a long haul, but they have a huge payoff. We spotted hundreds of beautiful boulders, rocks, and ledges in 250-450 feet of water at the Sticky Grounds.  This chart contains 405 waypoints.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

charts.name: Elbow
charts.description:
This chart contains 265 waypoints and covers a 20-mile-long ledge system located about 80 miles west of Tampa Bay. Depth ranges from 150-200 feet. There are tons of rugged rocky outcroppings and high-relief ledges in this area.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us.  Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: Destin Hardbottom
charts.description:
We made this chart as a custom job and it has received some stellar reviews. Highly recommended.

About a dozen hardbottom areas near Destin Pass. A couple hundred acres of ledges, rocks and ridges. All spots are in state waters.

What you see in the preview map is exactly how the chart appears on your GPS display. The red lines trace reef structure, and the points label the areas.

Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level.

On the checkout confirmation page and the order confirmation email (check your spam folder) you will be provided a link to download the chart file.  Download the file, double click it, and read the instructions inside.  If you’d like a physical chart card mailed to you instead, please email or call us. Make sure to create an account at checkout so you can log back in and access your StrikeLines files at any time.  Tight lines!

charts.name: 3D Shelf Edge Synthetic (Northern Gulf of Mexico)
charts.description:
• Available only for Lowrance, Simrad, Garmin and Google Earth.
  • Shelf Edge from the Mississippi River to Port St. Joe.
  • High-resolution bottom hardness and ruggedness information.
  • Replaces built-in "shaded relief" data when card is inserted.
  • This is not a numbers list!
  • This makes numbers lists obsolete.
  • (We are very proud of this map.)
  • Download the Synthetic Instructions for installation instructions, tips, and tricks.
Depths on this preview chart may be displayed in fathoms (6 feet), meters, or feet depending on your zoom level. charts.name: Pensacola Bay 2.0
charts.description:
• Version 2.0 Updated for improved performance on Raymarine hardware
  • 150+ fishing waypoints with names and descriptions.
  • Now includes two offshore reefs, Dutch Banks and Three Barges.
  • Dozens of large ledges in the pass.
  • Uncharted shipwrecks.
  • Rubble piles at shrimp trawler dump sites.
  • Submerged and exposed pipes.
  • Live bottom areas.

  • 100s of miles of traced structure

  • Yellow Gravel
  • The Nipple
  • 29 Edge
  • Oriskany shelf
  • Desoto Canyon north rim
